query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 «O Padre nostro, che ne’ cieli stai, 2 non circunscritto, ma per più amore 3 ch’ai primi effetti di là sù tu hai,
query.result: 1 "Our Father, who art in the heavens, 2 not circumscribed, but for the greater love 3 that thou hast for the first effects up there,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
4 laudato sia ’l tuo nome e ’l tuo valore 5 da ogne creatura, com’ è degno 6 di render grazie al tuo dolce vapore.
query.result: 4 praised be thy name and thy worth 5 by every creature, as is worthy 6 to give thanks for thy sweet breath.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
7 Vegna ver’ noi la pace del tuo regno, 8 ché noi ad essa non potem da noi, 9 s’ella non vien, con tutto nostro ingegno.
query.result: 7 May the peace of thy kingdom come to us, 8 for we cannot attain it by ourselves, 9 if it does not come, with all our intellect.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Come del suo voler li angeli tuoi 11 fan sacrificio a te, cantando osanna, 12 così facciano li uomini de’ suoi.
query.result: 10 As thy angels make sacrifice to thee of their will, 11 singing hosanna, 12 so may men do of theirs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 Dà oggi a noi la cotidiana manna, 14 sanza la qual per questo aspro diserto 15 a retro va chi più di gir s’affanna.
query.result: 13 Give us this day our daily manna, 14 without which in this harsh desert 15 he who strives to go forward goes backward.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 E come noi lo mal ch’avem sofferto 17 perdoniamo a ciascuno, e tu perdona 18 benigno, e non guardar lo nostro merto.
query.result: 16 And as we pardon each and every one 17 the evil that we have suffered, so do you 18 pardon us, and do not consider our merit.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 Nostra virtù che di legger s’adona, 20 non spermentar con l’antico avversaro, 21 ma libera da lui che sì la sprona.
query.result: 19 Our virtue, which is easily overcome, 20 do not test with the ancient adversary, 21 but free yourself from him who spurs it on.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Quest’ ultima preghiera, segnor caro, 23 già non si fa per noi, ché non bisogna, 24 ma per color che dietro a noi restaro».
query.result: 22 This last prayer, dear Lord, 23 is not made for us, for we have no need, 24 but for those who will remain after us."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
25 Così a sé e noi buona ramogna 26 quell’ ombre orando, andavan sotto ’l pondo, 27 simile a quel che talvolta si sogna,
query.result: 25 Thus praying for themselves and for us, 26 those shades went beneath their burdens, 27 similar to what one sometimes dreams,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 disparmente angosciate tutte a tondo 29 e lasse su per la prima cornice, 30 purgando la caligine del mondo.
query.result: 28 all variously anguished, circling around 29 and weary on the first ledge, 30 purging the darkness of the world.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
31 Se di là sempre ben per noi si dice, 32 di qua che dire e far per lor si puote 33 da quei c’hanno al voler buona radice?
query.result: 31 If from there they always speak well of us, 32 what can be said and done for them from here 33 by those who have a good root to their will?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 Ben si de’ loro atar lavar le note 35 che portar quinci, sì che, mondi e lievi, 36 possano uscire a le stellate ruote.
query.result: 34 Their stains that they carry from here should indeed be washed away, 35 so that, clean and light, 36 they can emerge to the starry spheres.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
